title.rendered: Minecraft fan conjures up song and the whole game is the instrument

content.rendered:
There’s something on your ears! A song made entirely of Minecraft sounds. Image: Mojang, Getty Images/Passakorn Prothien.

The most impressive buildings and the most remarkable ideas are created in Minecraft. While there is usually something to marvel at with the eyes, now a fan conjures up a creation that is intended for your ears.

Cat, Chicken and Villager: Minecraft song is wild

While the Minecraft subreddit is usually bursting with buildings and visual creations, one player has now come up with a completely different creative expression of the sandbox game. A Minecraft song. And only from existing in-game sounds.

Instead of relying on melodic sounds, KaelonDrae has more unusual sounds served for his track. From cackling chickens to meowing cats to dying pigs – the creators seem particularly taken with the animals in the survival games.

The whole thing is accompanied by a few video excerpts, which skilfully stage the stars of the sounds. Listen to the result for yourself in the Reddit post:

What does the community think of the Minecraft song?

On Reddit, the community celebrates the idiosyncratic track and speaks in over 100 comments and almost 6,000 upvotes her praise.

Some jokingly ask when Spotify release is to be expected for the song. The user HiFreinds thinks it’s good that KaelonDrae has stayed true to the original sounds and hasn’t changed them with the FL Studio program used.

However, KaelonDrae admits that he at least edited the villager’s voice. Many also guess which sounds are still relevant and are amazed that simple noises, such as running over blocks of grass, can conjure up such a result.

Several commentators wish that Piece of music also available as a record in the gamewhich can be collected in the world of survival games.

The catchy tune is guaranteed for many and especially the cat ending is a crowning glory for this extraordinary Minecraft song.
